description: This module, comprising of three seminars, is the first of five modules that make up a 9-month long course. This module introduces students to the relevant institutions in the legal system in Singapore such as the different levels of courts, civil vs criminal processes etc. The module also introduces students to the idea of legal reasoning in a common law system. Students will also be taught the basic methodology of statutory interpretation, in particular, the purposive approach. They will learn how to interpret basic to middle-complex statutory issues, including the plain and contextual approach, use of Hansard etc.
title: Fundamentals of Legal Reasoning
